TopicTitle: [1.4.3] Gameslinx's Planet Overhaul v3.4.0 [UPDATE IN PROGRESS]

Articles.Content: Hmm... I sorta get why people don't like the earthy planets, but this pack has been unique from the start. Just look at Niebotos, or Olu'um. What's so bad about having one slightly unrealistic pack in a sea of realistic ones? I love it. And I put a cool picture from neibos as my phone's home screen, cos that's how awesome the rings look. ( I would post it, but I'm stupid and I cant figure out how!)

Hmm... I sorta get why people don't like the earthy planets, but this pack has been unique from the start. Just look at Niebotos, or Olu'um. What's so bad about having one slightly unrealistic pack in a sea of realistic ones? I love it. And I put a cool picture from neibos as my phone's home screen, cos that's how awesome the rings look. ( I would post it, but I'm stupid and I cant figure out how!) 

If you upload your image to an image hosting site like Imgur (.com), you can copy the image link and put it here.

I'm glad you enjoy the planet pack - It's approaching its third month of development!

On 28/03/2017 at 7:10 PM, The White Guardian said:

altitude vs. heat-per-frame

Ahhhh that makes a lot more sense

If I set it to a negative number, will that reduce heat? I'm thinking that the further away from the lava you are, you cool down more (if your temperature is 2000 yet the lava is 1000, your temperature should decrease)

As in, 

Hazardous ocean

{

  0 3500

  10 -5

9 hours ago, Gameslinx said:

Ahhhh that makes a lot more sense

If I set it to a negative number, will that reduce heat? I'm thinking that the further away from the lava you are, you cool down more (if your temperature is 2000 yet the lava is 1000, your temperature should decrease)

As in, 

Hazardous ocean

{

  0 3500

  10 -5

AFAIK it adds the temperature on the y-axis to the craft every frame, so negative could work, but I'm not sure if it's a good idea. The curve you posted here means that people can just hover over 10m and cool down immensely fast.

Your best bet would be to gradually decrease the temperature-per-frame taking heat radiation into account. I'm willing to write the curve for you if you'd like, I made one for Cyran to simulate it's superheated atmosphere and heat radiation.

9 minutes ago, The White Guardian said:

AFAIK it adds the temperature on the y-axis to the craft every frame, so negative could work, but I'm not sure if it's a good idea. The curve you posted here means that people can just hover over 10m and cool down immensely fast.

Your best bet would be to gradually decrease the temperature-per-frame taking heat radiation into account. I'm willing to write the curve for you if you'd like, I made one for Cyran to simulate it's superheated atmosphere and heat radiation.

Don't worry about a heat curve - either way - getting too close to lava = dead!

Little question about this mod, it "just" add new planets and moon or does it replace the stock solar system like Galileo? I have some stations and bases in the stock system and i don't want to delete them when adding the mod.

And, I think the question have been asked several times but what about the compatibility with outters planets mod?

Thanks for help.

Edited April 4, 2017 by AstroValou

39 minutes ago, AstroValou said:

Little question about this mod, it "just" add new planets and moon or does it replace the stock solar system like Galileo? I have some stations and bases in the stock system and i don't want to delete them when adding the mod.

And, I think the question have been asked several times but what about the compatibility with outters planets mod?

Thanks for help.

1) No stock planets are changed. Not even Eeloo.

2) It has full compatibility. No planets will collide - one of them comes close, but that's a feature so you can jump between the planets and get a boost out to the veeeeery far out planets in this pack. let me know if there are issues!
Wow, what a quick answer, great thanks to you, i'll test it soon

27 minutes ago, AstroValou said:

Wow, what a quick answer, great thanks to you, i'll test it soon

I'm always checking my email for replies.

It's become second nature that every 10 minutes or so I refresh gmail!

Edited April 4, 2017 by Gameslinx
well i WAS tagged in something.. maybe not

9 minutes ago, Galileo said:

well i WAS tagged in something.. maybe not

Sorry - I removed it because I (sort of) figured the issue out.

I'm trying to set the home planet to one of those from my pack. I've managed to do that, but now I need to add the SpaceCenter to the planet. I've got a config set up, but it's lodged halfway in the terrain!

yep. read this

https://github.com/NathanKell/RealSolarSystem/wiki/PQSCity-and-PQSMod_MapDecalTangent

7 minutes ago, Galileo said:

yep. read this

https://github.com/NathanKell/RealSolarSystem/wiki/PQSCity-and-PQSMod_MapDecalTangent

Thanks

28 minutes ago, Galileo said:

yep. read this

https://github.com/NathanKell/RealSolarSystem/wiki/PQSCity-and-PQSMod_MapDecalTangent 

PQSCity
			{
				KEYname = KSC
				latitude = 0
				longitude = 40.67
				repositionRadiusOffset = 3062
				repositionToSphereSurface = True
				lodvisibleRangeMult = 6
				reorientFinalAngle = 78
			}

When repositionToSphereSurface is true, it is still waaaay below it. I've also tried setting it to 'True', '1' and even 'Yes' (lol). am I missing something?

dont use that setting. That is the lazy way to do it and its not always accurate

Also, you dont have the MapDecal in your cfg? why not? its pretty necessary. it flattens out the terrain you want to put your KSC on. otherwise, well everything winds up in the ground

You need to adjust the absoluteOffset in the MapDecal to be equal to the altitude of the terrain you want KSC to be on

then you need to adjust 

repositionRadiusOffset = 3062

to be -9 of your absoluteOffset value. (-9 is just what i use, but it works)

 

Edited April 4, 2017 by Galileo

8 minutes ago, Galileo said:

dont use that setting. That is the lazy way to do it and its not always accurate

Also, you dont have the MapDecal in your cfg? why not? its pretty necessary. it flattens out the terrain you want to put your KSC on. otherwise, well everything winds up in the ground

 

I've got the MapDecal, I just didn't put it in the snippet there.

I won't use the lazy way, then
I updated my last comment
@Gameslinx check on the main Kopernicus thread for the KopernicusExamples that @KillAshley created, you'll find the link in the OP. One of the example configs is moving the KSC.
